abstract: Lawsuit filed by Minnesota chapter of American Civil Liberties Union and Minneapolis NAACP requests authorities release video from Nov, 2015, night when black man Jamar Clark was fatally shot by Minneapolis police officer; officials will not release video until case is closed; suit notes Gov Mark Dayton was allowed to view video, and has no greater legal right to do so than does public.
lead_paragraph: The Minnesota chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union and the Minneapolis N.A.A.C.P. filed a lawsuit in hopes of forcing the authorities to release video from the night a black man was killed by a Minneapolis police officer.

headline.main: Minnesota: Rights Groups Sue for Release of Video
headline.print_headline: Minnesota: Rights Groups Sue for Release of Video

snippet: The Minnesota chapter of the American Civil Liberties Union and the Minneapolis N.A.A.C.P. filed a lawsuit in hopes of forcing the authorities to release video from the night a black man was killed by a Minneapolis police officer.
